humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the patient has invasive ductal carcinoma of the right breast, with no metastases to the lymph nodes (pNo) and that the sentinel lymph nodes were negative for metastatic carcinoma (sn). This corresponds to N0, which indicates no metastases to the lymph nodes. The new rule 10 and 11 support this prediction. The N0 stage is reported as pNo/sn in this case, which is consistent with the AJCC staging system. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N0 (pNo/sn).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The 'pNo' in the histopathology diagnosis indicates that there is no evidence of cancer in the regional lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N0.
